metadata.title: Supporting Continuity Camera in your tvOS app

inlineContent.text: Continuity Camera brings the power of the cameras and microphones from an iOS or
iPadOS device to Apple TV, including advanced features like Center Stage and Portrait mode.
This sample project provides an example implementation that accesses a camera and
microphone from a nearby iPhone or iPad in an Apple TV app.
It builds on a similar sample,

inlineContent.overridingTitle: Supporting Continuity Camera in your macOS app

overridingTitleInlineContent.text: Supporting Continuity Camera in your macOS app

inlineContent.text: and shares some of its functionality, including automatic camera selection
and observing the state of video effects.
The following sections focus on the aspects specific to tvOS.
This sample code project is associated with WWDC23 session 10256:
To run this sample app, you need the following:
An Apple TV 4k (2nd generation) or later with tvOS 17 or later.
An iPhone or iPad with iOS 17 or iPadOS 17, respectively, or later.
You need to run this sample code project on physical devices, because
Simulator doesnâ€™t include the components to support cameras.
Continuity Camera works with all iPhone and iPad models that support
video effects in Control Center.
You need to sign in with an Apple ID that uses two-factor authentication for the
Apple TV and the device with a camera.
You can use a separate Apple ID for each device or the same Apple ID for both.
The first time you run the app on an Apple TV, the system prompts you for permission to
access to the camera and microphone.
The app needs these permissions to function correctly.

abstract.text: A view controller that provides an interface to a person so they can select and connect a continuity device to the system.

A `continuityDevicePicker` should be used to discover and connect nearby continuity device through a button interface or other form of activation. On tvOS, this presents a fullscreen continuity device picker experience when selected. The modal view covers as much the screen of `self` as possible when a given condition is true.
Configure system voice processing and respond to speech events.
A property that bypasses all processing for microphone uplink done by the voice processing unit.
Notify objects about changes to the properties of other objects.
A property wrapper type that can read and write a value owned by a source of truth.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
A notification dispatch mechanism that enables the broadcast of information to registered observers.
An informal protocol that objects adopt to be notified of changes to the specified properties of other objects.
